alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 21 at 9:57AM EST until February 26 at 11:01AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-220300- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0008.000000T0000Z-220226T1601Z/ /URVO1.1.ER.220217T2239Z.220219T0645Z.220226T1000Z.NO/ 957 AM EST Mon Feb 21 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Monday was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight, before rising above flood stage again early Wednesday afternoon, reaching 12.4 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage again early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
